PropertyList.title: MiG-23MLD
PropertyList.text:
Gunsight ------- The ASP-17ML is a gunsight (ASP) with integrated radar screen (RP). Use the lever at the buttom left to switch between the two.
The gunsight has the following operating modes, which can be selected with the rotary knob: - deflection mode (PZ) when firing the gun at maneuvering (M) and non-maneuvering (NM) aerial targets - deflection mode (PZ) mode or non-synchronous mode (N.SIN) when firing cannon or unguided rockets at maneuvering and nonmaneuvering ground targets - bombing mode with conventional (OB) and retarded bombs (TB) - target designation mode when launching boost-phase ballistic missiles
RWR ---- The rectangular device on the right hand panel is the SPO-15 radar warning receiver. The small green lights around the center indicate the direction of received radar signals, the bigger yellow lights next to it indicate the biggest threat, the small rectangular lights around the center indicate the signal strength of the biggest threat and the lights at the bottom indicate the radar type. The types are as follows (from left to right):
1.) Airborne radar 2.) Long-range radar 3.) Medium-range radar 4.) Short-range radar 5.) Early warning radar 6.) AWACS
A/A Weapons ---------- R-3S: Short range missile with IR (infrared) seeker (copy of AIM-9B). Cannot be placed at outer pylons (smoke damages aircraft engine). R-13M: Short range missile with IR seeker (similar to AIM-9G) R-24R: BVR (beyond visual range) missile with SAR (semi-active radar) seeker R-24T: BVR (beyond visual range) missile with IR seeker R-60M: Leightweight short range missile with IR seeker R-73: Advanced short range IR missile with thrust vector control
A/G Weapons ---------- UPK-23: External 23mm cannon UB-32: Launcher for unguided S-5 missiles S-24: Unguided missile Kh-23: Remote controlled missile (i,j,k,l keys) FAB-500: Bomb RBK-500: Cluster bomb
